_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Friday, January 30th, 2026 - Good Morning Skiers and Riders! This is Eli with your snow report from 5am for Friday, January 30th  . Remember the easiest way to get up to date information is on the Ikon Pass app or website.  

At Mid Mountain, weve had 3 new inches of snow in the past 24 hours, with 4 inches falling at the Summit. All of that did fall before the mountain closed yesterday.  

Our Mid mountain base is 30 inches, the temperature is 18 degrees, the winds are 8 miles per hour from the west, with partly cloudy skies. 

The Summit base is 46 inches, the temperature is 10 degrees, the winds 14 miles per hour from the west. 

The base temperature is 23 degrees.  

We will be skiing and riding on 19 lifts, 161 runs, and 2,801 acres on Packed Powder. Night skiing will be available tonight from 5:30-8:30pm with 5 runs and 1,100 vertical feet off of Christie Peak Express! 

Join us in Steamboat Square tomorrow, January 31 at 5:30 for the Ski Town U.S.A. Celebration, honoring the Ski Town athletes and legends who helped shape our mountains legacy. From heartfelt recognition to community pride, this is a chance to celebrate the people who put Steamboat on the world stage. Get all the event details at steamboat.com/events. 

Stay in the know with the Ikon Pass App. Find it in the app store on your mobile device and get lift and trail statuses, conditions updates, and more.  

If you are thinking of exploring outside the ski area boundaries, and dont know exactly where you are going, dont go.  

Ski and Ride with Care and we will see you on the mountain!
